abstract: Pres Obama will use speech at Federal Trade Commission to call on Congress to pass Personal Data Notification and Protection Act, which will create national standard for companies regarding breaches of their customers' personal data; Obama will also unveil Student Data Privacy Act, which prohibits companies from making profit from information they collect in schools; both laws will be touched on in Obama's State of the Union address.
lead_paragraph: The announcement is part of a weeklong focus on privacy and cybersecurity by President Obama ahead of his State of the Union address on Jan. 20.

byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Washington, and Natasha Singer from New York.
byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and NATASHA SINGER

snippet: The announcement is part of a weeklong focus on privacy and cybersecurity by President Obama ahead of his State of the Union address on Jan. 20.

headline.main: Obama to Call for Laws Covering Data Hacking and Student Privacy
headline.print_headline: Obama to Call for Laws Covering Data Hacking and Student Privacy
